How to Disinfect Your Kitchen
Disinfecting the kitchen just might be one of the most important parts of your cleaning routine. We can show you how to kill germs on kitchen surfaces safely, with or without bleach.
More from Clorox experts
By
Mary Gagliardi
Discover more ways to clean.
Use as directed.
Whether you use a bleach and water solution or choose a bleach-free approach, killing germs in the kitchen should be part of your regular cleaning routine.
For bleach-free cleaning and disinfecting, we recommend the Clorox® Free & Clear line. This trio of Clorox products is formulated without bleach, ammonia or dyes, and it's safe around kids, pets and food.* No rinse required!

Disinfecting with bleach
What you need
Clorox®
Disinfecting Bleach with CLOROMAX® - Concentrated Formula
Learn more

Measuring spoons
24 oz. plastic spray bottle
Protective gloves
Safety glasses
Steps to disinfect kitchen surfaces with bleach
Open a window
Open a window to circulate fresh air into the room where you will be cleaning.
Mix the bleach and water solution
Measure 3 cups of water into the spray bottle. Wearing protective gloves and safety glasses, add 3 teaspoons of Clorox® Disinfecting Bleach. Insert the trigger sprayer into the bottle and tighten before adjusting the nozzle to spray a fine mist.
Tip
Bleach and water solutions must be made fresh daily.
Pre-clean surfaces
If needed, use a microfiber cloth dampened with water to wipe any obvious smudges or grime from surfaces before the disinfecting step.
Disinfect
Spray the bleach and water solution onto common kitchen surfaces such as sealed granite, painted wood, stainless steel, glazed ceramic tile, grout, porcelain, enamel and plastic. Spray additional solution on as needed to keep the surface wet for 6 minutes to disinfect, then wipe away with a microfiber cloth.
Tip
For mold and mildew stains, let the bleach and water stay on the surface for up to 10 minutes.
Rinse
Soak another microfiber cloth with clean water and then wipe all the treated surfaces to rinse away any residual bleach solution.
Air dry
Allow surfaces to air dry.

Steps to disinfecting kitchen surfaces with Free & Clear
Pre-clean surfaces
If needed, use Clorox® Free & Clear Compostable Cleaning Wipes to clean away obvious dirt or grime from refrigerator doors, cabinet handles, trash cans, faucets, countertops, microwaves and toasters before the disinfecting step. Or spray with Clorox® Free and Clear Multi-Surface Spray Cleaner and wipe clean with a paper towel before disinfecting.
Tip
No rinsing is required after cleaning with Free & Clear cleaning products.
Disinfect
Hold Clorox® Free & Clear Disinfecting Mist 6-8 inches from the surface and spray until thoroughly wet.
Tip
Surface must remain visibly wet for 2 minutes to disinfect.
Air dry
No rinsing is required. Simply allow the surface to air dry completely- you can spray and walk away.

An important safety message
Bleach and other disinfectants are not suitable for consumption or injection under any circumstances. People should always read the label for proper usage instructions. Disinfecting surfaces with bleach and the disinfecting products is one of the ways to help stop the spread of COVID-19, according to the Centers for Disease Control. Our products are safe when used as directed. It’s critical that everyone understands the facts in order to keep themselves safe and healthy.
